Rooms Database Helpers (room_service/database.py)¶

This part of the project is the databse of the rooms service.

room_service.database.delete_room_row(name)¶

delete a room row by name. it simply returns number of deleted rows (0 if none matched).

room_service.database.find_room_by_name(name)¶

look up one room by its name.

room_service.database.get_db_connection()¶

open a connection to the rooms database and return it. connection uses sqlite3.Row so we can access columns by name.

room_service.database.insert_room(name, capacity, equipment, location, status='available')¶

insert a new room and return it as a dict. it takes as parameters: name as in name of the room ( unique),capacity(max nb of ppl), equipment (comma separated list), location(floor, building etc), status(available/booked) it returns newly inserted row as a dict, or None if something went wrong.

room_service.database.list_all_rooms()¶

return all rooms as a list of dicts.

room_service.database.make_rooms_table_if_missing()¶

create the rooms table if not already exist. called once at begining so the other code can assume the table is there.

room_service.database.search_available_rooms(min_capacity=None, location=None, equipment_contains=None)¶

searchs for available rooms with simple filters. the following filters are optional: min_capacity(rooms with capacity >= this value), location(substring that must appear in the location), equipment_contains(substring that must appear in the equipment). Only rooms with status = “available” are returned.

room_service.database.update_room_row(name, new_capacity, new_equipment, new_location, new_status)¶

update a room row and return the updated row. takes in as parameters: name of the room to update, new capacity, new equipment string, new location string, new status string. then returns Updated room row, or None if the room does not exist.
